zjchv3zvfg50.title: Incident with Issues, API Requests and Git Operations
zjchv3zvfg50.summary: On 2023-09-19 at 20:36 UTC, Projects data becoming unavailable for approximately four hours. While working to restore Projects data, we also experienced a data replication interruption which affected Git Operations, APIs, and Issues.
zjchv3zvfg50.root cause: While migrating the primary datastore for Projects, we caused an outage.
zjchv3zvfg50.mitigation: We first resolved the data replication issue, which returned Git Operations, APIs, and Issues to normal operation. We then restored Projects data to its pre-migration state, and re-inserted data that was added during the period of partial availability. The incident was resolved on 2023-09-20 at 00:06 UTC.
zjchv3zvfg50.long-term mitigation: As a result of this incident, we have improved validation of data migrations in test and during rollout. We have also identified improvements to reduce both the time to restore and to fix the replication issue.

Project data modified between 20:36 UTC and 20 Sep 00:06 UTC was partially restored. We will publish a root cause analysis for this issue by Sep 29.

04:02 UTC on 20 Sep 2023: Issues is operating normally.

04:28 UTC on 20 Sep 2023: On 2023-09-19 at 20:36 UTC, while migrating the primary datastore for Projects, we caused an outage that led to Projects data becoming unavailable for approximately four hours. While working to restore Projects data, we also experienced a data replication interruption which affected Git Operations, APIs, and Issues. We first resolved the data replication issue, which returned Git Operations, APIs, and Issues to normal operation. We then restored Projects data to its pre-migration state, and re-inserted data that was added during the period of partial availability. The incident was resolved on 2023-09-20 at 00:06 UTC. As a result of this incident, we have improved validation of data migrations in test and during rollout. We have also identified improvements to reduce both the time to restore and to fix the replication issue.

wlb83pxg009y.title: Disruption with some GitHub services
wlb83pxg009y.summary: Between September 27, 2024, 15:26 UTC and September 27, 2024, 15:34 UTC the Repositories Releases service was degraded. During this time 9% of requests to list releases via API or the webpage received a `500 Internal Server` error.
wlb83pxg009y.root cause: This was due to a bug in our software roll out strategy.
wlb83pxg009y.mitigation: The rollout was reverted starting at 15:30 UTC, which began to restore functionality. The rollback was completed at 15:34 UTC.
wlb83pxg009y.long-term mitigation: We are continuing to improve our testing infrastructure to ensure that bugs such as this one can be detected before they make their way into production.
wlb83pxg009y.updates: 15:30 UTC on 27 Sep 2024: Between September 27, 2024, 15:26 UTC and September 27, 2024, 15:34 UTC the Repositories Releases service was degraded. During this time 9% of requests to list releases via API or the webpage received a `500 Internal Server` error. This was due to a bug in our software roll out strategy. The rollout was reverted starting at 15:30 UTC, which began to restore functionality. The rollback was completed at 15:34 UTC. We are continuing to improve our testing infrastructure to ensure that bugs such as this one can be detected before they make their way into production.

w6g0cmvyx3vm.title: Incident with Pull Requests and API Requests
w6g0cmvyx3vm.summary: On December 3, 2024, between 19:35 UTC and 20:05 UTC API requests, Actions, Pull Requests and Issues were degraded. Web and API requests for Pull Requests experienced a 3.5% error rate and Issues had a 1.2% error rate. The highest impact was for users who experienced errors while creating and commenting on Pull Requests and Issues. Actions had a 3.3% error rate in jobs and delays on some updates during this time.
w6g0cmvyx3vm.root cause: This was due to an erroneous database credential change impacting write access to Issues and Pull Requests data.
w6g0cmvyx3vm.mitigation: We mitigated the incident by reverting the credential change at 19:52 UTC. We continued to monitor service recovery before resolving the incident at 20:05 UTC.
w6g0cmvyx3vm.long-term mitigation: There are a few improvements we are making in response to this. We are investing in safe guards to the change management process in order to prevent erroneous database credential changes. Additionally, the initial rollback attempt was unsuccessful which led to a longer time to mitigate. We were able to revert through an alternative method and are updating our playbooks to document this mitigation strategy.
w6g0cmvyx3vm.updates:

19:59 UTC on 03 Dec 2024: We have taken mitigating actions and are starting to see recovery but are continuing to monitor and ensure full recovery. Some users may still see errors.

20:05 UTC on 03 Dec 2024: On December 3, 2024, between 19:35 UTC and 20:05 UTC API requests, Actions, Pull Requests and Issues were degraded. Web and API requests for Pull Requests experienced a 3.5% error rate and Issues had a 1.2% error rate. The highest impact was for users who experienced errors while creating and commenting on Pull Requests and Issues. Actions had a 3.3% error rate in jobs and delays on some updates during this time. This was due to an erroneous database credential change impacting write access to Issues and Pull Requests data. We mitigated the incident by reverting the credential change at 19:52 UTC. We continued to monitor service recovery before resolving the incident at 20:05 UTC. There are a few improvements we are making in response to this. We are investing in safe guards to the change management process in order to prevent erroneous database credential changes. Additionally, the initial rollback attempt was unsuccessful which led to a longer time to mitigate. We were able to revert through an alternative method and are updating our playbooks to document this mitigation strategy.
